thread.title: ‘F*** you’: New controversy emerges from UCL epic
thread.title_full: ‘F*** you’: New controversy emerges from UCL epic

title: ‘F*** you’: New controversy emerges from UCL epic
text:
PSG mob hit by Motta's car 0:26 Barcelona v PSG fallout: Referee reportedly told PSG players ‘f*** you’ when questioning decisions March 12, 2017 10:40am by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS AT first the talk was about how well Barcelona played in the 6-1 Champions League win over PSG. 
That’s changed - especially in Paris. 
According to French newspaper Le Parisian , referee Deniz Aytekin told PSG players to “f*** you” whenever his decisions were questioned in the match. 
Aytekin’s performance was heavily scrutinised after he gave Barca two penalties and rejected calls from PSG after Javier Mascherano’s challenge on Angel Di Maria, who fluffed a shot inside Barca’s box with the score at 3-1. 
PSG President Nasser Al-Khelaifi told Le Parisian: “You cannot help but think that the result of this match could have been different with clairvoyant refereeing, and more as the competition progresses, there is a lot at stake and the referees need to know it, there is no room for nervousness or lack of lucidity.” 
REACTION: How the world lost its marbles for Barca PSG's Marco Verratti, right, argues with the referee Deniz Ayetekin. Source: AP 
He added: “Everyone saw the penalty to Di Maria that would have put us 3-2 up. Not to mention the penalty on Suarez.” 
However, new footage of the penalty Suarez was awarded in stoppage-time seems to suggest defender Marquinhos made contact with the Barca striker. 
With the score at 4-1 in Barca’s favour, a ball was lifted over the top to Suarez. Marquinhos put his arm across the striker, but Suarez went to ground very easily. 
The penalty was Barca’s fifth goal (that Neymar converted) before Sergi Roberto scored the sixth and vital goal in the 95th minute. When a defender trips an opposing player in the box it’s a penalty.End of story! pic.twitter.com/jzDtpO1skF
